Module com.example.miniproyecto4
Package com.example.miniproyecto4.model.Ship

Class Ship

java.lang.Object
com.example.miniproyecto4.model.Ship.Ship
All Implemented Interfaces:
IShip, Serializable
public class Ship extends Object implements IShip, Serializable
Represents a ship in the Battleship game. Manages ship position, orientation, hit tracking, and sunk status. Implements Serializable to support game state persistence.
See Also:
  • Serialized Form

    Constructs a Ship of the specified type with a starting position and orientation.

  • Constructor Details

    • Ship

      public Ship(ShipType type)
      Constructs a Ship of the specified type without position information. Initializes empty hit coordinates and coordinates lists.
      Parameters:
      type - the type of ship to create

    • Ship

      public Ship(ShipType type, Coordinate startCoordinate, Orientation orientation)
      Constructs a Ship of the specified type with a starting position and orientation. Sets the ship's position and calculates all occupied coordinates.
      Parameters:
      type - the type of ship to create
      startCoordinate - the starting coordinate for the ship
      orientation - the orientation of the ship (horizontal or vertical)

    • hit

      public boolean hit(Coordinate coordinate)
      Registers a hit at the specified coordinate if it is part of the ship and has not been hit before.
      Specified by:
      hit in interface IShip
      Parameters:
      coordinate - the coordinate where the hit occurred
      Returns:
      true if the hit was successful, false otherwise

    • isSunk

      public boolean isSunk()
      Checks if the ship has been sunk. A ship is sunk when all of its coordinates have been hit.
      Specified by:
      isSunk in interface IShip
      Returns:
      true if the ship is sunk, false otherwise

    • setPosition

      public void setPosition(Coordinate coordinate, Orientation orientation)
      Sets the position and orientation of the ship. Calculates all coordinates occupied by the ship based on its size and orientation.
      Specified by:
      setPosition in interface IShip
      Parameters:
